citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
In early September 2022, a 1-year-old, male mountain lion was found deceased inside its enclosure by the licensee. At
the time, this mountain lion was housed in the same enclosure with a male littermate. According to the licensee, there was
no indication of trauma or obvious cause of death, and it was not being treated for any illnesses at the time. The Attending
Veterinarian (AV) did not learn of this death until late October 2022 while on a routine visit to the premises. Per the
Attending Veterinarian, a necropsy and further diagnostic testing would have been recommended if given timely
information in this situation. Due to not being informed of the mountain lion’s death, the AV was unable to provide
guidance or to properly exercise their authority to ensure the provision of adequate veterinary care at the facility. Failure
to ensure the AV has the appropriate authority for adequate veterinary care may put the other littermate and other animals
at risk of a contagious disease or negatively impact their health and well-being. Exhibiting facilities must assure that the
attending veterinarian has appropriate authority to ensure the provision of adequate veterinary care and to oversee the
adequacy of other aspects of animal care and use.
Correct by close of business 05/25/2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
ALEXANDRA ANDRICOS, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
2.40(a)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
In early September 2022, a 1-year-old, male mountain lion was found deceased inside its enclosure by the licensee. At 
the time, this mountain lion was housed in the same enclosure with a male littermate. According to the licensee, there was

Attending Veterinarian, a necropsy and further diagnostic testing would have been recommended if given timely 
information in this situation. Due to not being informed of the mountain lion’s death, the AV was unable to provide 
guidance or to properly exercise their authority to ensure the provision of adequate veterinary care at the facility. Failure 
to ensure the AV has the appropriate authority for adequate veterinary care may put the other littermate and other animals 
at risk of a contagious disease or negatively impact their health and well-being. Exhibiting facilities must assure that the 
attending veterinarian has appropriate authority to ensure the provision of adequate veterinary care and to oversee the 
adequacy of other aspects of animal care and use. 
Correct by close of business 05/25/2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.

Additional Inspectors: 
ALEXANDRA ANDRICOS, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

species.common: DOMESTIC PIG / POTBELLY PIG / MICRO PIG
